titleInfo.title: Oral history interview with Judge John L. Draper, 1980 November, excerpt 03

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: CentIIIDraper audio cassette recording converted to mp3 format in 2006.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville judge John L. Draper., conducted on two dates in November 1980 by Malcolm McKinney as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. Draper, who served Nashville as a magistrate (1929-1937), General Sessions Judge (1937-1960), and Criminal Court Judge (1960-1982), discusses transportation when he was growing up in Goodlettsville. He describes the horse-drawn vehicles that his family owned. The complete interview is available in the repository.

titleInfo.title: Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project
